title: Kayseri Atatürk Stadium
text:
Kayseri Atatürk Stadium, opened in 1964, was a <a href="multi-purpose%20stadium">multi-purpose stadium</a> in <a href="Kayseri">Kayseri</a>, <a href="Turkey">Turkey</a>. It was mainly used for <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> matches, and was shared by the two largest clubs in the region, <a href="Kayserispor">Kayserispor</a> who currently play in the <a href="Turkcell%20Super%20League">Turkcell Super League</a> and <a href="Kayseri%20Erciyesspor">Kayseri Erciyesspor</a> who were last season relegated into the Turkish Second Division. The stadium was able to hold 26,500 people, and was mostly uncovered.
During a match between <a href="Kayseri%20Erciyesspor">Kayseri Erciyesspor</a> and <a href="Sivasspor">Sivasspor</a> on September 17, 1967, it was the location of the worst <a href="1967%20Kayseri%20Atat%C3%BCrk%20Stadium%20disaster">sporting-related disaster</a> occurred in Turkey.
In 2009, it was replaced by <a href="Kadir%20Has%20Stadium">Kadir Has Stadium</a>, located on a different site with a capacity in excess of 32,000 seats. Kayseri Atatürk Stadium was demolished and its land will host a multi-use real estate project, including a shopping mall, hotel, offices, and residential buildings.
